User Item Access

 

  • User Item Access
    • Creating User Item Access 
    • Deleting User Item Access 
      • Field Description

The user item access enables you with the item access filters. The supplies and allocations that are viewed by users are filtered by an item access filter. 

 

Note: This page can be accessed by administrators and managers. An item access filter can be assigned to users via user item access.

 

Filters: 

  1. Item Access Filter Id
  2. User

Creating User Item Access 

You can create a user item access filter via a wizard.

 

To create item access filter:

  1. Select Menu > Configurations  > User > User Item Access 
  2. Enter the filter criteria and click Apply. The list pane with records is displayed. 
  3. Click Create to view the new Create User Item Access wizard. 
  4. From the User Item Access Definition section, select the Item Access Filter Id from the drop-down list.
  5. Select User from the drop-down list.
Note: Mandatory fields are denoted with *.
  1. Click Save and Finish. The user item access record is created.

Deleting User Item Access 

To delete user item access: 

  1. Select Menu > Configurations  > User >  User Item Access 
  2. Enter the filter criteria and click Apply. The user item access records meeting the filter criteria are listed.
Note: You can delete a method record either through the Swipe-out board option or the Delete button.

Swipe Out Board

  1.  Select the Swipe-out board option on the required record card and select Delete.
  2. A warning message pop-up prompts as 'Deletion of User Item Access is irreversible'.
  3. Click Yes to delete the user item access record.

Delete

  1. Select the required record. The footer section with action buttons is displayed.
  2. A warning message pop-up prompts as 'Deletion of User Item Access is irreversible'.
  3. Click Yes to delete the user-item access record.
Field Description

The following are the field description attributes:

 

Field

Description
Action Buttons
Related Links

Select the records and click on the Related Links (View Item Access Filter) hyperlink to navigate to the Item Access Filter screen.

Item Access Filter details can be quickly accessed from the User Item Access page via the Item Access Filter Id hyperlink.
Export  Exports the list of user-item access attributes, and the file will be downloaded onto your system. View Export for more information.
Select All Rows Selects all the user-item access records.
Deselect Clear the selected records.
Delete Delete the user-item access records.

 

Note: The user item access page cannot be edited.
